book.title: Principia Dobsonia
book.description: Frank Key reports on Dobson, Hooting Yard's out-of-print pamphleteer.
book.subject: Hooting Yard
book.author: Frank Key
book.publisher: Hooting Yard Archivists a.k.a. The Soup Committee

section.title: A Pair of Pamphlets (out of print)

Transcript of a Dictaphone Recording Made by Dobson at the 1955 Festival of Argumentative Music in Ülm
Downy, Witched, Dutch Cloud-heaps of Some Quaintest Tramontane Nephelococcugia of Thought
The Teutonic Memory-banks of Mister Blatfinch
Escape From a Ship on Fire
How Bodger's Spinney Got Its Name
With Dobson in the Land of Nod
Homage to Esther and Abi Ofarim
The Dark Night of the Soul
In a Cabin, on a Ship
Tadeusz Kapisko and His Ears of Wheat
A Special Christmas Treat for All Our Readers
A Special Christmas Treat, Part Two
A Third Episode of Blodgett Island
Certain Aspects of Plastic Baubles and Plastic Sheeting
The Potato Clock : History and Prospects
Attempted Seduction of Dobson by a Floozie
The Unspeakably Squalid Becrumplement of Tadzio Gobbo
One In A Series Of Hiking Pickles
“He Which Is Filthy, Let Him Be Filthy Still”
The Man Who Would Be Dobson
Drink Ye Every One The Waters Of His Own Cistern, Until I Come And Take You Away
The Tale Of The Boffin And The Guttersnipe
Toffee Apple Wrapper Saved From The Flames
Thousands Of Unusual And Arresting Facts About Birds
By Pointy Town Horse-Trough I Sat Down And Wept
An Essay Concerning A Bird Perched On A Promontory
Disquieting Ploppy Noises From Behind The Panel
Three Examples Of Uncontrollable Flapping About And Twitching
Chucking-Out Time At The Cow & Pins
The Hooting Yard Encyclopaedia Of Birds
The Bell And The Toads, Etcetera
A Short Essay Upon Cardboard Breakfast Cereal Packets
Flight Patterns Of The Common Shrike
Poultry Yards Of The Grand Archdukes
Neither Dobson Nor Blötzmann Nor Joost Van Dongelbraacke
On Having The Prize Within One's Grasp
On The One-Eyed Crossing-Sweeper Of Sawdust Bridge
On The Livers Of Polar Bears
On The Sea, For Those In Peril
On The Crooked Timber Of Humanity
On Tadeusz Kapisko And His Ears Of Wheat
Dining Well On Moss And Eels
Reflections On Poles And Holes And Moles
Which Out Of Print Dobson Pamphlet Are You?
The Glue In The Palace Was Rarefied; The Putty Was Dreadful [Pseudodobson]
